results.description:
Weekly activity: For anyone who plans to come, it would be nice (but not necessary) if you could try working on a comic specifically for the purpose of showing us. The idea is to get it finished or at least finished enough to present when you come to the meetups, so that we can share and talk about them. This activity is not required to come, but it will let us have more to talk about during the meetup.

Though the time says 2:00, I will try to arrive there by at least 1:30, so do feel free to arrive by then. You can text[masked] or[masked] if you are ever confused about where to go.

Direction:


If you are coming by subway, we suggest you to stop at the Copley Station through green line.


We shall be in the Norman B. Levanthal Map Center (on the first floor after you go through the courtyard), in the room with computers at the back of it (through a door that says "Exhibition Continues"). Please message or call us or comment here if you are confused where that is.

results.description:
We traditionally have a large social meetup twice each month. This gives everyone an opportunity to come and make new friends, practice their Japanese or English, and spend time with a bunch of interesting people from around the Boston area and overseas.  This meetup may be cancelled if there are very few RSVPs.

Close to Boylston on the Green Line, or Chinatown on the Orange Line.
Also a short walk from Park Street or Downtown Crossing. 

• From Boylston Station, go south on Tremont Street (away from Boston Common),  then take a right onto Stuart Street.  The food court will be on your right; you enter the building right by the Dunkin Donuts.

• From Chinatown Station, go west on Boylston Street (toward Boston Common), then take a left onto Tremont Street. Turn right onto Stuart Street. The food court will be on your right; you enter the building right by the Dunkin Donuts.

There is a map of the area below. If you have trouble finding us, please feel free to call or text me at[masked]-2923.  Also you can call or text if you come after we have left for Chinatown, although then there is a greater chance I will miss the call.

Come on by, relax, practice in either language of your choice, and enjoy being part of our growing community!

The Meetup does not end at 6 - instead, some time around there, we usually go out to Chinatown for dinner afterwards to eat family style - anyone who wants to come is welcome. The cost is usually around $12-20/person (not including any drinks for which people pay their own way).  We are open to restaurant suggestions.  However, I am not willing to get into dividing up large numbers of orders on one giant check, which is why we generally go to Chinatown and split everything down the middle.  If you don't want to eat at all, you can come and just enjoy the company for free.  

Please BRING CASH if you can and want to go to dinner - many of the restaurants limit cards to two per table, so if a lot of people have no cash it can be a problem.

Stuart Street view
results.how_to_find_us: We usually have several tables pulled together at the highest point of the food court nearest the elevator.
results.name: Saturday Social Meetup at City Place

results.description:
A great opportunity to tour & enjoy unique tastings from an artisanal distillery with an interesting story. See the process up close! Dirty Water is a micro-distillery conveniently located a block from 'The Rock', right in the heart of Plymouth. There will be fun & informative give-aways...

Dirty Water intentionally set out to innovate. So rather than recreate liquors that everyone is familiar with, the goal is to explore & discover new flavors (infusions) to share. We'll learn all about these.

Not your grandfather's liquor (except one)..., rather new & exciting liquors that offer a modern taste, enabling outstanding & unique cocktails.

And they are anxious to share new libation recipe's to take home & try!

Exciting things are happening at Dirty Water Distillery...!

Be sure your rsvp includes a current profile photo, so we can recognize & welcome you.
results.name: LOCAL DISTILLERY TASTE & TOUR

results.description:
To be a vegetarian is good for your body, your soul and your planet! However, to be a well-informed vegetarian is even better. Let’s plan to read together great vegetarian books, watch movies/documentaries and, later, discuss them in a circle of vegetarian friends. Book selections will be recommended by a professional librarian or by you. Please provide me with your wish list of books that you want to read together as a group. We will plan to meet on a monthly basis.

For our April discussion, we can either watch the documentary The Engine 2 Kitchen Rescue with Rip Esselstyn (2011), read The Engine 2 Diet: The Texas Firefighter's 28-Day Save-Your-Life Plan that Lowers Cholesterol and Burns Away the Pounds (2009), do both or simply show up to join in for a discussion over a cup of coffee, a tea, or a light meal.

About the Documentary:

Watch The Engine 2 Kitchen Rescue with Rip Esselstyn (2011) and join Rip, a former Texas firefighter and The New York Times bestselling author, as he teaches the the basics of a whole-food, plant-based diet. Step-by-step, Rip will guide you on how to take control of your own health through: undertaking a top-to-bottom pantry clean-out, showing how to navigate the grocery store aisles to not get burned by misleading nutritional labels and cooking lessons to make tantalizingly plant-strong dishes.


About the Book:

The Engine 2 Diet appeared on The New York Times Best Seller List and was endorsed by Chicago Mayor Rahm Emanuel, who made a public appearance with Esselstyn in January 2013. In 2010, Whole Foods Market included The Engine 2 Diet as a "Healthy Eating Partner."


Professional athlete-turned-firefighter Rip Esselstyn is used to responding to emergencies. So, when he learned that some of his fellow Engine 2 firefighters in Austin, TX, were in dire physical condition-several had dangerously high cholesterol levels (the highest was 344!)-he sprang into action and created a life-saving plan for the firehouse. His plant-powered eating plan is based on a diet of whole foods, including whole grains, fresh fruits, vegetables, legumes, nuts, and seeds.


This invaluable guide features: dozens of easy, mouthwatering recipes-from pancakes to pizza, Tex-Mex favorites to knockout chocolate desserts-that will keep you looking forward to every bite; Pantry-stocking tips will take the panic out of inevitable cravings and on-the-fly meals; guidelines on menu choices that will allow you to eat out, wherever and whenever you want; Rip's simple, firefighter-inspired exercise program that will boost your metabolism and melt your fat away.


Medically approved, easy-to-follow, and amazingly effective, this diet is designed for anyone who wants to make heroic strides in his or her health, weight, and well-being-all without heroic effort.
results.name: Discussion of The Engine 2 Diet and The Engine 2 Kitchen Rescue

results.description: Join me this Saturday at Karma Yoga Studio (right above Trident Cafe on Newbury St.) for "Namaste Saturdays" which is a 40 minute meditation class followed by 20 minutes of group reiki. results.name: Saturday Backbay Meditation/Reiki

results.description:
Architecture is a visual art, and the buildings speak for themselves. Julia Morgan
Come explore and learn the art of seeing abstract structures. During this new workshop we will focus on the left and right banks of Fort Point Channel. 

 We will photograph sections of the Financial District and the Seaport District. These established and emerging districts face each other and are divided by the Fort Point Channel, which offers wonderful reflections of the buildings.  I will provide maps if you are not familiar with the area. 

Photo By Suzanne Merritt

There is a hidden structure to architecture what we will learn to reveal in our images. By learning to see patterns, visual rhythm and dynamic tension, you can compose your image in a way that captures our imaginations, inspires us and brings us joy. 


Photo by participant Larry B. Great visual rhythm and use of complementary colors.

An abstract photo is often viewed with the response, wow that's beautiful, but what is it? Abstract photos delight us even if we are not sure why. They are created in the moment you feel a shift and see something in a fresh way. I have developed some simple practices to help you feel that shift and see your world with fresh eyes. I will share 3 of these with you during the program this Saturday.

Photo by Lisa W. Workshop participant. Fort Point Channel Reflections.

Learning to see creatively means slowing down to notice simple details right in front of you the have the potential to make a great photo. The things other people walk right by will suddenly jump out at you begging for your attention.

Photo By Suzanne Merritt

First,we will meet in front of the InterContinental Hotel near South Station. I will introduce you to some simple step by step practices for creative seeing so you can find beauty in the most unexpected places. I will show you some inspiring example photos to help get you started. I will help challenge your assumptions about what makes an interesting photo by giving you specific structured assignments.  I design these assignments very carefully to build your skills step by step.

Photo By Robert L. workshop participant. Wonderful use of diagonal composition and geometric shapes.

You will have a chance to try these out right away with my guidance. You will receive individual coaching and critique while we are in the field shooting. This way you can be confident that you will be able to repeat the process next time you are out on a shoot.

We will work with color, texture, pattern, and light to make our photos come to life. As always, this is a non technical jargon zone. It is all about the creative act of seeing and capturing the moments of life with a fresh eye.

Photo by Lisa W. Nice capture of detail repeated pattern fresh perspective.

This workshop is for you if:

• You want to join a group of like minded people and learn some new photography skills. 

• You are interested in abstract photography but not sure what makes a "good" photo.

• You are familiar with composition "rule of thirds" but not sure how to apply it to abstract subjects. We will go beyond the rule of thirds in this workshop. 


• You are attracted to the visual elements of color, pattern and texture.

Photo by workshop participant Deb D.  using zoom technique during class.

Any camera is fine for this shoot. You can even use your iPhone if you like. This is a fun, fast paced workshop. So if you would like to meet other people who love photography and are curious about how to take better photos, I hope you will join us.  If you do have a tripod and wide angle lens this is a good opportunity to use them.

The tuition for the workshop is $45.00 and included handouts, one on one instruction as needed. If you need some extra help with camera settings we can do that too.  I am keeping the group size small for this one. Only 10. 

We will be staying out for Blue Hour, that magical time after sunset when the sky turns brilliant blue and the lights of the city start to come up. We will end class in a spot where you can take a spectacular image of the Boston Skyline. 

Photo by professional photographer Chris Lazier Boston Skyline Blue hour. This inspires me to stay out for blue hour this week.  

We are going to have a great time! You have joined the group, now join the fun. 

RSVP right away to hold your space. I look forward to seeing you Saturday. We will also stop for refreshments after class at a local pub and look at our photos.

Suzanne

About your instructor: Suzanne Merritt is a master level photography instructor with a studio at the Boston Center for the Arts. She has been leading workshops on the topics of creativity, photography and beauty in Asia, Europe and the US. for over 20 years. Suzanne was the founder of the Polaroid Creativity Lab and has recently launched the Curious Soul Photo School. You can see her photography and subscribe to her blog at www.curioussoulphotos.com 

Suzanne's award winning book: Flow-tography on iTunes.
results.how_to_find_us: Details provided once I have the full class list.
results.name: Abstract Architecture: Financial District & Fort Point Channel Dusk & Blue Hour

results.description:
Crystal Bowl Sound Immersion
w/ Laura Hackel
April 30th @ 6 – 7PM
$25 registration fee

REGISTER HERE


Possibilities. You enter this life with so many of them. But then, somewhere along the way, you seem to have fewer and fewer of them. Your life can feel like a well-worn track. Where did all the possibilities go? They still exist, but beliefs, ideas and patterns acquired over a lifetime tend to bury them. Crystal Bowl Healings work to quickly shift your vibrational energy field and release whatever is limiting you; Whether it’s a belief that you have enough and it would be selfish to want more, or that you don’t deserve to have what you want in life.

As you sit or lay in a meditative state, I play the bowls, allowing the beautiful sounds and vibrations to work their magic in your energy field. The bowls play differently each time, affected by the energy in the room and what is needed to help you release old patterns.

By the end of the session, you will be ready for the new possibilities that are about to walk right into your life!

The crystal bowls are for you if you are:

* Stuck in any area of your life

* Wanting to experience more out of life but aren’t sure how

* Experiencing self- sabotaging patterns

* Wanting to make a change in life but aren’t sure how

* Wanting to make changes at your own pace


Come discover the power of intentionally releasing and being open to what the universe is calling for you to bring into your life!

REGISTER HERE
results.name: Crystal Bowl Sound Immersion

results.description:
Star Studded Cast and  not one but two evil queens, should be cool.

Showtime is at 7:30.  I will be in the theater by 6:30 and will head upstairs around 6:45.   We will gather at the tables at the top of the escalator by the windows and head in for seats around 7.  Tickets are on sale now on Fandango. 


In general, I arrive at the theater an hour before the show to start gathering people, and we head in for seats about 30 minutes before the show, so we can sit together. This also allows us to take turns getting snacks, etc., before the previews start.  It also allows for any unexpected, last minute changes at the theater.  Although fairly infrequent, having wiggle room to exchange tickets, etc. is VERY helpful.

Please note, everyone is responsible for buying their own tickets.  And while it is possible to buy your ticket at the door, shows often sell out. I strongly advise you to buy your tickets in advance.  I will announce when tickets go on sale on Fandango. Please do NOT buy tickets until I have finalized the time.

If you miss the group ahead of time, come find us after. We gather in the hallway outside of the theater we just saw the movie in, to discuss the film a bit, allow for restroom breaks and to get a head count of all those who would like to go out after for drinks and munchies.

$$$$Managing the after event is much easier if everyone brings cash, so please plan ahead if you want to go out with the group after.  We will be splitting one bill for the group. No separate checks.$$$

One more thing, please keep your rsvp's up to date so I can plan the after event and know who to look for.  Thanks!

Movie Details:

Release date: April 22, 2016

Studio: Universal Pictures

Director: Cedric Nicolas-Troyan

MPAA Rating: PG-13 (for fantasy action violence and some sensuality)

Screenwriters: Evan Spiliotopoulos, Craig Mazin

Starring: Chris Hemsworth, Charlize Theron, Emily Blunt, Jessica Chastain, Nick Frost

Genre: Action, Adventure

Official website:

TheHuntsmanmovie.com

|

Facebook

|

Twitter

|

Instagram

Plot Summary:

The fantastical world of Snow White and the Huntsman expands to reveal how the fates of The Huntsman Eric and Queen Ravenna are deeply and dangerously intertwined. Chris Hemsworth and Oscar® winner Charlize Theron return to their roles in "The Huntsman Winter’s War," an epic action-adventure in which they are joined by Emily Blunt and Jessica Chastain, as well as director Cedric Nicolas-Troyan. Producer Joe Roth ("Maleficent," "Alice in Wonderland") once again leads the team in a breathtaking new tale nested in the legendary saga.

Long before the evil Queen Ravenna (Theron) was thought vanquished by Snow White’s blade, she watched silently as her sister, Freya (Blunt), suffered a heartbreaking betrayal and fled their kingdom. With Freya’s ability to freeze any enemy, the young ice queen has spent decades in a remote wintry palace raising a legion of deadly huntsmen—including Eric (Hemsworth) and warrior Sara (Chastain)—only to find that her prized two defied her one demand: Forever harden your hearts to love.

When Freya learns of her sister’s demise, she summons her remaining soldiers to bring the Magic Mirror home to the only sorceress left who can harness its power. But once she discovers Ravenna can be resurrected from its golden depths, the wicked sisters threaten this enchanted land with twice the darkest force it’s ever seen. Now, their amassing army shall prove undefeatable…unless the banished huntsmen who broke their queen’s cardinal rule can fight their way back to one another.
results.name: The Huntsman: Winter’s War (7:30 PM Show)

Described as the very best and very worst of humanity's humor from the greatest card game on Earth.  Come out and meet singles while trading laughs and testing your sarcasm by playing "Cards Against Humanity."  If you're not easily offended and enjoy a good laugh - this is the perfect icebreaker!  It's the best way to get rid of the butterflies and turn your night into social high gear.

For more information on the game, please visit www.cardsagainsthumanity.com.

You're bound to make a new friend, connection, or possible future date by just showing up.  Also, don't forget to ask about our matchmaking services where you can meet more professional Boston singles outside of this event. 80% of first timers report that they are nervous only leading up to the event, so do not worry if this is your first time. Scenergy believes in an open environment where our hosts ensure you feel welcome, safe, and are having fun - we hope to see you there!

Agenda:

7:00 p.m. - 7:30 p.m. - Participants Arrive & Register (If at the door, tickets are available).

7:30 p.m. - 9:00 p.m. - "Cards Against Humanity" begins.

9:00 p.m. - TBD - Raffle Prizes and closing remarks.

Price:

- All tickets include your first drink

- $30 at the door (if tickets available)

- $20 pre-paid RSVP *(Limited to 25 male/ 25 female tickets)

Early bird special: 

First 10 to use promocode "earlybird" save $5 off the prepaid price (pay $15 instead of $20).

Pre-pay by CLICKING HERE

* Once all 25 male/ 25 female tickets have been sold, we will release more tickets in increments. We are able to hold a maximum of 60 singles (30 males / 30 females)!

Recommended Attire:

Men - Come presentable; highly recommend collared shirt with jeans or slacks.

Women - Come casual but classy; do not have to come in a dress but blouses recommended over shirts.

If you've never been to a Scenergy Dating event and/or a bit nervous and want to know what to expect - watch the below video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gtF3Vlx1BX8

results.description:
How far can one grape travel?

You may already know that Syrah and Shiraz wines are made from the same grape – the Syrah. It’s just pronounced and spelled differently around the world.

This dark, almost black, grape began its life in France but has settled in many regions around the world. It’s the wine maker that chooses how to refer to their wine. Generally though, Australians and South Africans refer to the wine as Shiraz, and the rest of the world will typically use the French pronunciation and spelling of Syrah. But of course that isn’t a rule.

Some research has shown that the Syrah grape is actually a descendent of two grapes from southeastern France: Mondeuse blance and Dureza. In case you were wondering, Petite Sirah is a completely different grape, but is often confused with Syrah and Shiraz.

Syrah highlights:

• Often from France


• Tends to be less fruit-forward, more elegant, tannic, smoke-flavored

• Similar to classic Northern Rhone reds

Shiraz highlights:

• Sometimes from Australia, but found in many regions around the world (Chile, Argentina, Western USA, South Africa, Switzerland, France, Italy, and possibly more)

• Tends to be made from ripe berries, big and jammy, fruit-forward, higher alcohol, tannins not as noticeable, peppery

Pairing:

Finding the right food to bring is going to depend on the region you selected your wine from. Everyone has their own method for determining food pairing, here is one example based on light- or full-bodied Syrah grape: http://winefolly.com/tutorial/syrah-food-pairing/

Tell us the region of your wine:

We're hoping to try Syrah/Shiraz from as many regions as possible. To do this we need your help. So when you purchase your wine, please post a comment to this event telling everyone where your wine is from (from that alone we will assume Syrah or Shiraz). The hosts will keep you updated with the tally in the comments section for those that haven't purchased wine yet. Let's try as much as we can to get a balance.

Price point:

Plan to spend between $20-$40

What to bring:

• 4 wine glasses

• Write your initials on the wine label somewhere, and then bring it in a paper bag. Your initials help reduce confusion after the blind tasting is over in the event two people bring the same wine.

• Bring a dish to share. Store bought or homemade is up to you.

• When you have your wine purchased, please post a comment of which varietal and region your wine is from.

See you there!
results.name: Syrah vs. Shiraz

venue.address_1: Address will be emailed a few days prior to the event
venue.name: Rich and Susan's

results.description:
Let's celebrate the arrival of spring by exploring our namesake – Syrah. 

Some fun wine thoughts… Did you know Syrah and Shiraz are the exact same wine? When Syrah arrived in Australia from its birthplace in France, Australian winemakers took to calling it Shiraz, instead of the grape’s original name, Syrah. No matter what you call it, Syrah is one of the darkest red wines on the market. Although Syrah originated in France, Syrah wines from the region tend to be expensive when sold in the U.S. In contrast, due to the larger amount of land devoted to the grape in Australia, Australian wineries have been able to produce the wine much more affordably, and it is due to this that the name Shiraz has become even more widely known on the American market than the grape’s original name, Syrah. 

Let’s enjoy a spring evening with good wines, good food, and fun conversation with new and old friends. Bring a bottle of Syrah and an appetizer to share. I will have some sweets to round things out.

Rich and I will host the evening at our home (Winthrop) and will forward the address to those attending a few days in advance. 

Remember Que Syrah Syrah rules... your wine must be under $15 a bottle. 

We look forward to enjoying a glass of wine with you!
results.name: Que Syrah Syrah

group.name: Que Syrah Syrah...A Different Kind of Wine Group

results.description:
Described as the very best and very worst of humanity's humor from the greatest card game on Earth.  Come out and meet singles while trading laughs and testing your sarcasm by playing "Cards Against Humanity."  If you're not easily offended and enjoy a good laugh - this is the perfect icebreaker!  It's the best way to get rid of the butterflies and turn your night into social high gear.

For more information on the game, please visit www.cardsagainsthumanity.com.

You're bound to make a new friend, connection, or possible future date by just showing up.  Also, don't forget to ask about our matchmaking services where you can meet more professional Boston singles outside of this event. 80% of first timers report that they are nervous only leading up to the event, so do not worry if this is your first time. Scenergy believes in an open environment where our hosts ensure you feel welcome, safe, and are having fun - we hope to see you there!

Agenda:

7:00 p.m. - 7:30 p.m. - Participants Arrive & Register (If at the door, tickets are available).

7:30 p.m. - 9:00 p.m. - "Cards Against Humanity" begins.

9:00 p.m. - TBD - Raffle Prizes and closing remarks.

Price:

- All tickets include your first drink

- $30 at the door (if tickets available)

- $20 pre-paid RSVP *(Limited to 25 male/ 25 female tickets)

Early bird special: 

First 10 to use promocode "earlybird" save $5 off the prepaid price (pay $15 instead of $20).

Pre-pay by CLICKING HERE

* Once all 25 male/ 25 female tickets have been sold, we will release more tickets in increments. We are able to hold a maximum of 60 singles (30 males / 30 females)!

Recommended Attire:

Men - Come presentable; highly recommend collared shirt with jeans or slacks.

Women - Come casual but classy; do not have to come in a dress but blouses recommended over shirts.

If you've never been to a Scenergy Dating event and/or a bit nervous and want to know what to expect - watch the below video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gtF3Vlx1BX8
results.name: Cards Against Humanity - Singles Edition (Ages: Mid 20's - Young 40's)

group.name: 20's & 30's Awesome Boston -- Happy Hours, Hikes, Good Stuff

results.description:
In this introductory workshop, we look at our love relationship with ourselves as a way to start enhancing our relationships with others, and indeed with our higher power.

"All of your relationships are inside of you...


If you are really interested in exploring how well you love yourself, and how that is reflected in how you are able to others, come to this two and half hour free workshop.

Through 1-1 processes, group sharing, and other group processes, we will work together raise the level of our loving consciousness.   You will leave with some valuable keys to living a more loving existence.

".......Ultimately, each relationship you have with another person reflects your relationship with yourself. How well (or poorly) you get along with yourself will be directly mirrored by how you get along with others inside of you and outside of you."  
- John-Roger (Relationships: The Art of Making Life Work)

Leaders: Vincent & Lesley Dupont

Peace Theological Seminary


PTS is a non-denominational, educational seminary that teaches practical spirituality in our changing world. PTS maintains that our primary relationship is with our own soul. The purpose of PTS is to facilitate learning the lessons of the physical and spiritual worlds. We maintain that our primary relationship is with our own soul and we provide educational opportunities that support students in becoming more aware of the divine in themselves.

We invite you to join with us in expanding your consciousness, enhancing your understanding, strengthening your spiritual awareness, embracing your loving, and allowing grace to lead the way.

Go to www.pts.org for more information
results.name: PTS: Loving Relationships

results.description:
We had a great dance and turnout in March for ZydeGroove. Let's keep the good times rolling by welcoming back Planet Zydeco for our April dance.

See a video of one of their events here.

Price is $18,  First time dancers and students are $9. 

Free dance lesson will start at 6:45pm. No partner necessary.

results.name: April Dance: Planet Zydeco

results.description:
It's a bit late notice, but this one will be easy to prepare for.  This Meetup was a great success last year - check out the gallery here:

http://www.meetup.com/GBNight/events/219890040/


We will be stepping out of our comfort zone a bit (okay, a lot) for a photo walk in the North End.  We will not use tripods or monopods on this shoot.  This will be a chance to pack light, and practice some techniques we don't often use in this group.  


The pictured route is just a suggestion.  There are plenty of interesting side streets and alleys to explore.

Before we head out I'll share some helpful techniques for hand held low light photography.  For starters, bring a fast lens: f2.8 or better if you have it.  This is the night for your 'nifty fifty' to shine.  If you don't have something that fast, fear not - there are several other tricks to help get great photos.

50mm and wider will be most useful, and are best for slow hand held shutter speeds. If you have a fast fisheye lens, bring it, it makes for unique perspectives.


There are several parking garages in the area as well as street parking.  If you are taking the T, get off at Haymarket or Aquarium.

It should be about 43 degrees and mostly cloudy.  Sunset is at 7:43, and we'll have no moon.

Seriously, no tripods!
results.name: North End Photowalk - No Tripods!

results.description:
Dear Boston Culture Lovers,


Let's dance and listen to live swing music, The Love Dogs band.  This event consists of a dance lesson followed by a general party.  All ages and dance levels welcome. 

Here is the outline for the night's schedule: 

- 7:45 pm: Meeting time for this MeetUp event, meet at the entrance/lobby to this venue. 

- 8:00 pm: Swing Dance Lesson FREE! (with cover charge)

• Introductory Swing Dance (East Coast/6-step)

• No partner needed. A great way to meet people!

• PLEASE ARRIVE BEFORE 8PM! No lesson admissions after 8:15 pm.

- 9:00 pm-Midnight: Dancing! Featuring live  music,  The Love Dogs band.   Just a reminder, this is an actual meet-up event, not an advertisement.  

Please only reserve "YES" if you are definitely attending and plan to meet members of the group.  If you reserve "YES" and have a change of plans, please update the attendance reservation.  A consistent history of not showing up for events may cause you to be removed from the group. 

If you arrive late, I can not guarantee that you will be able to recognize members of the group from the crowds. 


I look forward to enjoying this event with the group.

Joana

Event and Venue Details ************************************

http://www.swingcityboston.com/

• Cover charge is $18 (includes dance lesson)

•  Parking


   - there is a lot of free parking at the venue's lot and nearby streets

   - For detailed directions and parking information, visit http://swingcityboston.com/directions.html
results.how_to_find_us: Lets meet at 7:45pm at the entrance
results.name: Swing City Dance Party with live band, The Love Dogs, includes dance lesson

results.description:
* This is an online only event. Job Seeker Apply, and they'll be contacted by Recruiters if selected *

Job Seeker Signup Page: http://math.im/dtdc

Recruiter Signup Page: http://math.im/dtdr


No long lines, No handshakes, until you're drafted!


AnalyticsWeek's Hire51 is bringing world's largest data analytics hiring drive to town. By last day of every month topdata and analytics talent applicant apply to Data Analytics Talent Drive to help us bring top data opportunities to topdata professionals.


Here's the process:

When: Each month talent run starts with first day of the month. (Data Analytics Hiring Drive resume collection stops last day of the previous month)


Where: In your own preferred city.


Process:

> For Job Seeker:

1. Applicant apply as Job Seeker at: http://math.im/dtdc

2. Anonymized candidates chosen by recruiters will be contacted via email in 3 weeks

3. Upon interview, successful drafted candidate is celebrated in #DataTalentDraft communityIf you're DRAFTED(interviewed and hired), we have some awesome swags for you.


> For Recruiter:

1. Recruiters signup using the form at: http://math.im/dtdr 

2. We will share anonymized candidate info and give a week to pick shortlisted candidates

3. Once recruiter shortlist winning profile, we will ask the candidate and send introduction

Here are some things to know about Data Analytics Hiring Drive:


• It is a continuously rolling event on monthly basis

• Candidates will be contacted once their profile is shortlisted by a recruiter

• The candidate profile is kept in database for 3 months

• Candidate with 3 months and older profile are requested to refresh the profile to activate it back again

• Hire51's Data Talent Draft works tirelessly to connect top talent with top recruiting companies

• We are designing an AI bot to scan your profile and go on a hunt to find the right job that suits your profile

• Every passing day we are getting smarter and connecting more profiles to right jobs

• You don't need to go anywhere to participate, just apply on the link given above & below and complete the process so our engine will start working to find right opportunity for you.

In case you missed the links above:

-> Data Analytics Hiring Drive Job-Seeker Signup @ http://math.im/dtdc

-> Data Analytics Hiring Drive Recruiter Signup @ http://math.im/dtdr

</a>

<a href="https://talentdraft.eventbrite.com/?access=dtd">

<a href="https://talentdraft.eventbrite.com/?access=dtd"></a>
results.name: #GetHired through Hire51's Data Analytics Hiring Drive (Virtual Event)

results.description:
Celebrate Easter with the Albanian Community at the Albanian Saint George Cathedral in South Boston, also known as Kisha e Fan Nolit by many. 

I am not a Christian, I am not religious, and I do not believe in God but I admire the effort and success that St. George and other Albanian churches and mosques in United States have had in bringing the Albanian community together. History has shown that the only times Albanians have been successful is when we have been UNITED. 

HOLY SATURDAY NIGHT, EASTER VIGIL. 9.30 pm 

THE RESURRECTION AND EASTER LITURGY  10 pm. 

I suggest you get there by 9 pm EST not Albanian Standard time as the cathedral will be packed and seating is more comfortable than standing in my opinion. 

Parking: There is Street Parking in front of the Church (double lane when there is a Church Event)  

" Feja e Shqiptarit eshtë Shqiptaria " Pashko Vasa 


You may visit cathedral's website at: http://www.saintgeorgecathedral.com/


Courtesy of the photo: 

Vesseli Photography http://veseliphotography.com/ 

ST. GEORGE CATHEDRALEASTER SERVICES ~ 2016

Dear Parishioners & Guests of St. George Cathedral:
We wish you a most holy and safe Easter celebration. In order to provide for the safety and comfort of each of you, the following rules will be followed during our Easter services:
1. All parishioners must be seated during the services. Standing will only be permitted in assigned areas. There can be no blocking of aisles or impeding access to safety exits. Please come to church early to be sure that you have a seat. Easter Resurrection Liturgy will begin on Saturday, April 30, promptly at 10:00 PM. Children under 12 years of age must be under adult supervision at all times.


2. Candles and Open Flames:  Children under 12 years of age are not permitted to have open flame candles. Safety light sticks will be available for them. All candles held by adults must be extinguished at the direction of the church ushers. At the announced time during the services, all candles will need to be extinguished for the safety of others.  SMOKING IS PROHIBITED ANYWHERE WITHIN CHURCH BUILDINGS.
*** THE BOSTON FIRE DEPARTMENT REQUIRES STRICT ADHERENCE TO THESE RULES ***


3. Appropriate dress is a sign of respect for God. Please, no extreme attire or hair styles (both men and women) are to be worn at church services.


4. Please refrain from talking during the services. Persons who wish to hold conversations should do so outside the church building.


5. Please TURN OFF all cell phones and pagers while in the church.


6. Parking is always an issue of concern in South Boston. Please make an effort to park beyond the front of the Cathedral and walk to the Cathedral in order to minimize the blockage of traffic. Ushers will make announcements with signs about cars that need to be moved immediately due to blocking. Under no circumstances should cars block fire hydrants. Cars parked in front of fire hydrants or at bus stops are subject to immediate ticketing and towing for the safety of us all. For safety sake, please follow the directions of ushers or police when parking or crossing streets.


By following these simple requests, our Easter celebration will be both memorable and safe for us all.


Thank you and Happy Easter!


St. George Cathedral Advisory Board
results.how_to_find_us: Contact Erin K., at (978) 395-7020 or admin@eventalb.com with questions or concerns
results.name: Celebrate Easter with the Albanian Community at St. George. a.k.a Kisha e Nolit

results.description:
That's right, Zach Armentrout & Julia Claire are back with another edition of The Mendoza Line! Every week we bring you the most amazing lineups of comics from Boston and beyond. And this week is no different. Come see why we won Boston A-List's Best Live Comedy award! This week's lineup of killers:

Paul Landwehr (Beantown Comedy Riot)

Tim McIntire (Mottley's, Boston Comedy Festival)

Jenny Chalikian (In from LA, The Comedy Studio, will make you love gin)

Jere Pilapil (Competitive Erotic Fan Fiction)

Al Park (Winner of the Boston Comedy Festival, Seattle International Comedy Festival, Winner of the Cleveland Comedy Festival, this guy amiright?)

Erin Judge (In from LA, Bridgetown, Eugene Mirman Comedy Festival)

Adam Mamawala (In from New York, Funny or Die, Girl Code)

I know; this lineup is so great it's almost a little upsetting, so get your tickets now to guarantee a seat! Our shows have been known to sell out so don't make us break your poor little heart.

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-mendoza-line-bostons-best-weekly-comedy-showcase-tickets-19606392247
results.name: The Mendoza Line comedy showcase!

Different StrokeZ is playing at Joco's in Waltham this Saturday, April 30th! If you listen to Hot 96.9 then you will love the songs these guys play! A mix of throwbacks from the 90's and 00's to current hits! The bar (on 450 Moody St. in Waltham) has awesome drinks and great food too and the best part is....THERE'S NO COVER!!

So what are we waiting for? Let's GET DOWN WIT DA GIT DOWN!!!

results.description:
Grab tickets now: http://www.theriottheater.com/krang-of-pop.html

You've loved MIYAMOTO'S REVENGE, the wildly popular video game comedy show sweeping the city and beyond. You've loved its sister show, GYGAX STRIKES BACK, serving up laughs about board games, card games, and RPGs - geek hilarity at its most analogue.


Now we now proudly present THE KRANG OF POP, capturing the breath of pop culture geekery, everything funny from comics, movies, TV, toys, nostalgia and more! Here we get to level with Daredevil, go back in time, and turn our Care Bare Stare toward the funniest and nerdiest comedy acts in Boston. SEE:

Alan Richardson
Amy Mastrobuono
Emmy Serviss
Rasheed Townes
Chris Gagne
Jack German
Wes Hazard
Sketch Comedy's Vitamin Snake
& Josh Poirier's Interesting Points panel show!

Catch our DEBUT SHOW - only at The Riot Theater, 4.30, 10:00PM!
results.name: The Krang of Pop! Pop Culture Comedy for CHEAP in JP!

group.name: Boston-area Comedy Lovers - Comedy shows for free (or cheap)

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
